purpose_text.para: Controls trapping to EL2 of accesses to CPACR, CPACR_EL1, trace, Activity Monitor, SME, Streaming SVE, SVE, and Advanced SIMD and floating-point functionality.

configuration_text.para: If EL2 is not implemented, this register is RES0 from EL3.
This register has no effect if EL2 is not enabled in the current Security state.

fields.fields_condition: When FEAT_VHE is implemented and HCR_EL2.E2H == 1

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
In AArch64 state, traps accesses to CPACR_EL1 from EL1 to EL2, when EL2 is enabled in the current Security state. The exception is reported using ESR_ELx.EC value 0x18.
In AArch32 state, traps accesses to CPACR from EL1 to EL2, when EL2 is enabled in the current Security state. The exception is reported using ESR_ELx.EC value 0x03.
When HCR_EL2.TGE is 1, this control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.

note.para: CPACR_EL1 and CPACR are not accessible at EL0.

field_value_description.para: This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.
EL1 accesses to CPACR_EL1 and CPACR are trapped to EL2, when EL2 is enabled in the current Security state.

field_description.para: Trap Activity Monitor access. Traps EL1 and EL0 accesses to all Activity Monitor registers to EL2, as follows:

content.para: In AArch64 state, accesses to the following registers are trapped to EL2, reported using ESR_ELx.EC value 0x18:

listitem.content: AMUSERENR_EL0, AMCFGR_EL0, AMCGCR_EL0, AMCNTENCLR0_EL0, AMCNTENCLR1_EL0, AMCNTENSET0_EL0, AMCNTENSET1_EL0, AMCR_EL0, AMEVCNTR0<n>_EL0, AMEVCNTR1<n>_EL0, AMEVTYPER0<n>_EL0, and AMEVTYPER1<n>_EL0.

content.para: In AArch32 state, MRC or MCR accesses to the following registers are trapped to EL2 and reported using ESR_ELx.EC value 0x03:

listitem.content: AMUSERENR, AMCFGR, AMCGCR, AMCNTENCLR0, AMCNTENCLR1, AMCNTENSET0, AMCNTENSET1, AMCR, AMEVTYPER0<n>, and AMEVTYPER1<n>.

content.para: In AArch32 state, MRRC or MCRR accesses to AMEVCNTR0<n> and AMEVCNTR1<n>, are trapped to EL2, reported using ESR_ELx.EC value 0x04.

field_value_description.para: Accesses from EL1 and EL0 to Activity Monitor registers are not trapped.
Accesses from EL1 and EL0 to Activity Monitor registers are trapped to EL2, when EL2 is enabled in the current Security state.

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
Enable access to POR_EL0.
Traps EL0 accesses to POR_EL0 to EL2, from AArch64 state only. The exception is reported using ESR_ELx.EC value 0x18.

field_value_description.para: This control causes EL0 access to POR_EL0 to be trapped.
This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
Traps System register accesses to all implemented trace registers from both Execution states to EL2, when EL2 is enabled in the current Security state, as follows:

content.para: In AArch64 state, accesses to trace registers with op0=2, op1=1, and CRn<0b1000 are trapped to EL2, reported using EC syndrome value 0x18.
In AArch32 state, MRC or MCR accesses to trace registers with cpnum=14, opc1=1, and CRn<0b1000 are trapped to EL2, reported using EC syndrome value 0x05.

note.para: The ETMv4 architecture and ETE do not permit EL0 to access the trace registers. If the trace unit implements FEAT_ETMv4 or ETE, EL0 accesses to the trace registers are UNDEFINED, and any resulting exception is higher priority than an exception that would be generated because the value of CPTR_EL2.TTA is 1.
EL2 does not provide traps on trace register accesses through the optional Memory-mapped interface.

field_description.para: System register accesses to the trace registers can have side-effects. When a System register access is trapped, any side-effects that are normally associated with the access do not occur before the exception is taken.
If System register access to the trace functionality is not supported, this bit is RES0.

field_value_description.para: This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.

Any attempt at EL0, EL1 or EL2, to execute a System register access to an implemented trace register is trapped to EL2, when EL2 is enabled in the current Security state, unless HCR_EL2.TGE is 0 and it is trapped by CPACR.NSTRCDIS or CPACR_EL1.TTA.
When HCR_EL2.TGE is 1, any attempt at EL0 or EL2 to execute a System register access to an implemented trace register is trapped to EL2, when EL2 is enabled in the current Security state.

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.

Traps execution at EL2, EL1, and EL0 of SME instructions, SVE instructions when FEAT_SVE is not implemented or the PE is in Streaming SVE mode, and instructions that directly access the SVCR, SMCR_EL1, or SMCR_EL2 System registers to EL2, when EL2 is enabled in the current Security state.
When instructions that directly access the SVCR System register are trapped with reference to this control, the MSR SVCRSM, MSR SVCRZA, and MSR SVCRSMZA instructions are also trapped.
The exception is reported using ESR_EL2.EC value of 0x1D, with an ISS code of 0x0000000.
This field does not affect whether Streaming SVE or SME register values are valid.
A trap taken as a result of CPTR_EL2.SMEN has precedence over a trap taken as a result of CPTR_EL2.FPEN.

field_value_description.para: This control causes execution of these instructions at EL2, EL1, and EL0 to be trapped.
When HCR_EL2.TGE is 0, this control does not cause execution of any instructions to be trapped.
When HCR_EL2.TGE is 1, this control causes execution of these instructions at EL0 to be trapped, but does not cause execution of any instructions at EL2 to be trapped.
This control causes execution of these instructions at EL2, EL1, and EL0 to be trapped.
This control does not cause execution of any instructions to be trapped.

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
Reserved, RES0.

Traps execution at EL2, EL1, and EL0 of instructions that access the Advanced SIMD and floating-point registers from both Execution states to EL2, when EL2 is enabled in the current Security state. The exception is reported using ESR_ELx.EC value 0x07.
Traps execution at EL2, EL1, and EL0 of SME and SVE instructions to EL2, when EL2 is enabled in the current Security state. The exception is reported using ESR_ELx.EC value 0x07.
A trap taken as a result of CPTR_EL2.SMEN has precedence over a trap taken as a result of CPTR_EL2.FPEN.
A trap taken as a result of CPTR_EL2.ZEN has precedence over a trap taken as a result of CPTR_EL2.FPEN.
Writes to MVFR0, MVFR1, and MVFR2 from EL1 or higher are CONSTRAINED UNPREDICTABLE and whether these accesses can be trapped by this control depends on implemented CONSTRAINED UNPREDICTABLE behavior.

listitem.content: Attempts to write to the FPSID count as use of the registers for accesses from EL1 or higher.

Accesses from EL0 to FPSID, MVFR0, MVFR1, MVFR2, and FPEXC are UNDEFINED, and any resulting exception is higher priority than an exception that would be generated because the value of CPTR_EL2.FPEN is not 0b11.

field_value_description.para: This control causes execution of these instructions at EL2, EL1, and EL0 to be trapped.
When HCR_EL2.TGE is 0, this control does not cause execution of any instructions to be trapped.
When HCR_EL2.TGE is 1, this control causes execution of these instructions at EL0 to be trapped, but does not cause execution of any instructions at EL2 to be trapped.
This control causes execution of these instructions at EL2, EL1, and EL0 to be trapped.
This control does not cause execution of any instructions to be trapped.

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.

Traps execution at EL2, EL1, and EL0 of SVE instructions when the PE is not in Streaming SVE mode, and instructions that directly access the ZCR_EL1 or ZCR_EL2 System registers to EL2, when EL2 is enabled in the current Security state.
The exception is reported using ESR_ELx.EC value 0x19.
A trap taken as a result of CPTR_EL2.ZEN has precedence over a trap taken as a result of CPTR_EL2.FPEN.

field_value_description.para: This control causes execution of these instructions at EL2, EL1, and EL0 to be trapped.
When HCR_EL2.TGE is 0, this control does not cause execution of any instructions to be trapped.
When HCR_EL2.TGE is 1, this control causes execution of these instructions at EL0 to be trapped, but does not cause execution of any instructions at EL2 to be trapped.
This control causes execution of these instructions at EL2, EL1, and EL0 to be trapped.
This control does not cause execution of any instructions to be trapped.

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
Reserved, RES0.

text_before_fields.para: This format applies in all Armv8.0 implementations.

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
In AArch64 state, traps accesses to CPACR_EL1 from EL1 to EL2, when EL2 is enabled in the current Security state. The exception is reported using ESR_ELx.EC value 0x18.
In AArch32 state, traps accesses to CPACR from EL1 to EL2, when EL2 is enabled in the current Security state. The exception is reported using ESR_ELx.EC value 0x03.
When HCR_EL2.TGE is 1, this control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.

note.para: CPACR_EL1 and CPACR are not accessible at EL0.

field_value_description.para: This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.
EL1 accesses to the following registers are trapped to EL2, when EL2 is enabled in the current Security state:

field_description.para: Trap Activity Monitor access. Traps EL1 and EL0 accesses to all Activity Monitor registers to EL2, as follows:

content.para: In AArch64 state, accesses to the following registers are trapped to EL2, reported using ESR_ELx.EC value 0x18:

listitem.content: AMUSERENR_EL0, AMCFGR_EL0, AMCGCR_EL0, AMCNTENCLR0_EL0, AMCNTENCLR1_EL0, AMCNTENSET0_EL0, AMCNTENSET1_EL0, AMCR_EL0, AMEVCNTR0<n>_EL0, AMEVCNTR1<n>_EL0, AMEVTYPER0<n>_EL0, and AMEVTYPER1<n>_EL0.

content.para: In AArch32 state, MCR or MRC accesses to the following registers are trapped to EL2 and reported using ESR_ELx.EC value 0x03:

listitem.content: AMUSERENR, AMCFGR, AMCGCR, AMCNTENCLR0, AMCNTENCLR1, AMCNTENSET0, AMCNTENSET1, AMCR, AMEVTYPER0<n>, and AMEVTYPER1<n>.

content.para: In AArch32 state, MCRR or MRRC accesses to AMEVCNTR0<n> and AMEVCNTR1<n>, are trapped to EL2, reported using ESR_ELx.EC value 0x04.

field_value_description.para: Accesses from EL1 and EL0 to Activity Monitor registers are not trapped.
Accesses from EL1 and EL0 to Activity Monitor registers are trapped to EL2, when EL2 is enabled in the current Security state.

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
Reserved, RES0.
Traps System register accesses to all implemented trace registers from both Execution states to EL2, when EL2 is enabled in the current Security state, as follows:

content.para: In AArch64 state, accesses to trace registers with op0=2, op1=1, and CRn<0b1000 are trapped to EL2, reported using EC syndrome value 0x18.
In AArch32 state, MRC or MCR accesses to trace registers with cpnum=14, opc1=1, and CRn<0b1000 are trapped to EL2, reported using EC syndrome value 0x05.

listitem.content: The ETMv4 architecture does not permit EL0 to access the trace registers. If the trace unit implements FEAT_ETMv4, EL0 accesses to the trace registers are UNDEFINED, and any resulting exception is higher priority than an exception that would be generated because the value of CPTR_EL2.TTA is 1.
EL2 does not provide traps on trace register accesses through the optional memory-mapped interface.

field_description.para: System register accesses to the trace registers can have side-effects. When a System register access is trapped, any side-effects that are normally associated with the access do not occur before the exception is taken.
If System register access to the trace functionality is not supported, this bit is RES0.

field_value_description.para: This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.

Any attempt at EL0, EL1, or EL2, to execute a System register access to an implemented trace register is trapped to EL2, when EL2 is enabled in the current Security state, unless it is trapped by one of the following controls:

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
Reserved, RES1.

Traps execution at EL2, EL1, and EL0 of SME instructions, SVE instructions when FEAT_SVE is not implemented or the PE is in Streaming SVE mode, and instructions that directly access the SVCR, SMCR_EL1, or SMCR_EL2 System registers to EL2, when EL2 is enabled in the current Security state.
When instructions that directly access the SVCR System register are trapped with reference to this control, the MSR SVCRSM, MSR SVCRZA, and MSR SVCRSMZA instructions are also trapped.
The exception is reported using ESR_EL2.EC value of 0x1D, with an ISS code of 0x0000000.
This field does not affect whether Streaming SVE or SME register values are valid.
A trap taken as a result of CPTR_EL2.TSM has precedence over a trap taken as a result of CPTR_EL2.TFP.

field_value_description.para: This control does not cause execution of any instructions to be trapped.
This control causes execution of these instructions at EL2, EL1, and EL0 to be trapped.

field_description.para: Reserved, RES1.
Reserved, RES0.
Traps execution of instructions which access the Advanced SIMD and floating-point functionality, from both Execution states to EL2, when EL2 is enabled in the current Security state, as follows:

listitem.content: In AArch64 state, accesses to the following registers are trapped to EL2, reported using ESR_ELx.EC value 0x07: FPCR, FPSR, FPEXC32_EL2, any of the SIMD and floating-point registers V0-V31, including their views as D0-D31 registers or S0-31 registers.

In AArch32 state, accesses to the following registers are trapped to EL2, reported using ESR_ELx.EC value 0x07: MVFR0, MVFR1, MVFR2, FPSCR, FPEXC, and any of the SIMD and floating-point registers Q0-15, including their views as D0-D31 registers or S0-31 registers. For the purposes of this trap, the architecture defines a VMSR access to FPSID from EL1 or higher as an access to a SIMD and floating-point register. Otherwise, permitted VMSR accesses to FPSID are ignored.

field_description.para: Traps execution at the same Exception levels of SME and SVE instructions to EL2, when EL2 is enabled in the current Security state. The exception is reported using ESR_ELx.EC value 0x07.
A trap taken as a result of CPTR_EL2.TSM has precedence over a trap taken as a result of CPTR_EL2.TFP.
A trap taken as a result of CPTR_EL2.TZ has precedence over a trap taken as a result of CPTR_EL2.TFP.

note.para: FPEXC32_EL2 is not accessible from EL0 using AArch64.
FPSID, MVFR0, MVFR1, and FPEXC are not accessible from EL0 using AArch32.

field_value_description.para: This control does not cause execution of any instructions to be trapped.
This control causes execution of these instructions at EL2, EL1, and EL0 to be trapped.

field_description.para: Reserved, RES1.

Traps execution at EL2, EL1, and EL0 of SVE instructions when the PE is not in Streaming SVE mode, and instructions that directly access the ZCR_EL2 or ZCR_EL1 System registers to EL2, when EL2 is enabled in the current Security state.
The exception is reported using ESR_ELx.EC value 0x19.
A trap taken as a result of CPTR_EL2.TZ has precedence over a trap taken as a result of CPTR_EL2.TFP.

field_value_description.para: This control does not cause execution of any instructions to be trapped.
This control causes execution of these instructions at EL2, EL1, and EL0 to be trapped.

field_description.para: Reserved, RES1.
Reserved, RES1.

reg_fieldset.fields_condition: When FEAT_VHE is implemented and HCR_EL2.E2H == 1

ps.name: MRS

MRS
